items.title: Account for kCFBooleanTrue and kCFBooleanFalse being present in bridged payloads
items.body:
This converts kCFBooleanTrue and kCFBooleanFalse into true and false and adds subclassing callout hooks for CFNumber to invoke swift routines.

Additionally it corrects the class callouts for cluster types when archiving plist types such that it invokes the class for coder instead of relying on the distinct type of the object being passed.

items.title: [cherry-pick][urlsession]pull request #903 from pushkarnk/print-debug
items.body: @parkera Though this is not critical, we have complains about this message causing a lot of noise. Can we have it in 3.1 please?

items.title: [URLSession]Fix for a timeout bug(SR-2681)
items.body:
Currently, we use the `URLSessionConfiguration.timeoutIntervalForRequest` value to trigger a timeout. https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-2681 reported a bug in which the timeout counter is not reset on every data transfer. 

This is from the API doc:
```
The request timeout interval controls how long (in seconds) a task should wait for additional data to
 arrive before giving up. The timer associated with this value is reset whenever new data arrives. 
When the request timer reaches the specified interval without receiving any new data, it triggers a timeout.
```

This patch tries to reuse the `_TimeoutSource` class which is currently used to trigger timeouts in MultiHandle, with some modifications. We reset the timer every time data is available.

items.title: [Test][NSURLSession] Chunked response
items.body: As discussed in #911, I've commented out the actual test (It's fail otherwise), but all needed functionality is included.

items.title: Fix for [SR-1250] NSJSONSerialization emits non-floating-point number…
items.body:
JSON serialization behaves differently on Linux.

eg : Serializing  
```let subject = "[12.1,10.0,0.0]" ```

on Darwin  gives - 12.1,10,0 
where as on Linux - 12.1,10.0,0.0  //.0 needs to be truncated

This fix aligns the ```JSONSerialization.jsonObject(with: data)```  behavior  to Darwin.

items.title: Master merge for #915
Remove final from vars in error related protocol extensions
items.body: This PR removes `final` from a few `var`s in the `__BridgedNSError` protocol. SR-1762 / apple/swift#8010 will generate a warning or error when `final` is present in a protocol extension. This PR will remove the warning, and will not modify dispatch behavior in any way.

items.title: [SR-4242] Add NSMutableOrderedSet subscript setter that is missing from non-Darwin
items.body:
`NSMutableOrderedSet` has a subscript setter imported to Darwin platforms, but the setter doesn't exist on Linux. 

This PR adds a subscript setter to `NSMutableOrderedSet` as a shortcut to `replaceObject(at:with:)`

items.title: Added fast path for Int and UInt
items.body:
As a follow on from #723 I've created fast path options for Int and UInt to further improve the performance of JSON Serialization. 

Below are some results I obtained by using a slightly modified version of the [benchmark](https://github.com/djones6/swift-corelibs-foundation/commit/867109e253550e4d1bcb99cfc681fdb02ce0f566) @djones6 developed, increased to 1000 repetitions and varying the payload size. I've included times for `String(describing:)` as that was the original proposed solution in #723 and felt it would offer a good comparative view.  

| Payload type:              |  Average Time (2 digit numbers) | Average Time (10 digit numbers)        | 
|------|:-------:|:------:|
| Baseline (current `master`)     | 1.932 | 2.631
| With String(describing:) (as rejected in #723 ) | 0.877 | 1.572 |
| Int/UInt fast Path (this PR) | 0.984 (2.0x faster than baseline) | 1.653 (1.6x faster than baseline) |

@djones6 and I also ran some tests against Kitura, these tests showed we are slightly better than `String(describing:)` for shorter numbers and on par with `String(describing:)` for longer numbers.

I've also added a few extra tests for serialization of the min/max values for Int and UInt as I felt these offered good values for testing the correct result is produced, also the current master implementation fails on max UInt. 

I haven't started work on Double/Floats yet but may do so if this fix is acceptable.

items.title: NSRegularExpression: Add default value to init() `options` parameter
items.body:
According to the [documentation](https://developer.apple.com/reference/foundation/nsregularexpression/1410900-init), the `options` parameter to the `NSRegularExpression` initializer should have a default value of `[]`.  This was not correct in swift-corelibs-foundation.

Correct the signature of the initializer and update one of the existing tests to cover this case.

items.title: Fix bit shift math in CFCharacterSet equality code
items.body:
The code was originally shifting a 32-bit value by 32 bits in
some cases, which is undefined behavior. The intent was that
all bits would be shifted out, leaving a value of 0 to perform
computation with. We now treat the value as 64-bits for the shift
and re-cast to 32-bits for the computation.

items.title: Remove blocks runtime when building with libdispatch
items.body:
- The blocks runtime is already contained in libdispatch
  so removing this 2nd copy from libFoundation removes duplicate
  code.

- The libdispatch version is also slightly more optimal as it
  doesnt compile functions only needed when HAVE_OBJC is defined.

This is also needed to avoid duplicate symbol errors when statically linking Foundation using https://github.com/apple/swift-corelibs-foundation/pull/873

Also see discussion about blocks runtime in https://github.com/apple/swift-corelibs-foundation/pull/874

An alternative, which I did test, is just to remove `data.c` and `runtime.c` although this means `libdispatch` always has to be linked in and Im not sure if it is guaranteed to always be a dependancy.

items.title: Fix a few leaks and an incomplete copy in CFURLComponents
items.body:
Addresses a few leaks:
* during deallocation of a CFURLComponentsRef, _portComponent was leaked
* _CFURLComponentsCopyURLRelativeToURL failed to CFRelease a local
* _CFURLComponentsCopyQueryItems failed to CFRelease a local

Incomplete copy in _CFURLComponentsCreateCopy:
* failed to transfer _passwordComponentValid along with _passwordComponent
* failed to transfer _parseInfo

items.title: Fix building on RasPi
items.body: Ubuntu on Raspberry Pi reports "arm-linux-gnueabihf". Since it still needs to link curl, I added the check for this triple ending.

items.title: Swift 3.1 branch data fixes
items.body:
this cherry picks the Data fixes for indexing and slicing:

Address slice regions that incorrectly fetched from the wrong offset of the backing buffers (#929)

* Update Data to be in sync with Foundation overlay

* Account for slice starts in appending, replacing subranges and fetching unsafe byte pointers

Correct Data slice iteration to be indexed by the startIndex to the endIndex
